market_context: US stock futures point to a lower open as investors digest mixed tech earnings, with Nvidia trading higher premarket after Q4 results amid ongoing AI disruption concerns, while Salesforce shares fell 3.5% on weak guidance.[1] Major indices rallied Wednesday (S&P 500 +0.81%, Nasdaq +1.41%, Dow +0.63%), but premarket futures are unchanged to slightly down ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks and economic data like jobless claims.[1][2][3] Treasury yields declined, oil edged higher, and gold held above $5,100 amid geopolitical focus.[1]

predictions.reasoning: Futures indicate a lower open after Wednesday's +0.81% S&P 500 gain, with investor digestion of tech earnings like Nvidia's volatile post-Q4 trading and Salesforce's 3.5% drop on AI worries.[1][2] Geopolitical risks from US-Iran nuclear talks in Geneva add downward pressure, outweighing prior AI-infrastructure strength.[1]

Nvidia traded higher premarket after Q4 earnings, supporting Nasdaq's prior +1.41% rise driven by AI chips and infrastructure, despite broader futures decline.[1][2] Salesforce weakness is isolated to software, while Nvidia's results ease some AI fears per headlines.[1]

Nvidia higher premarket post-Q4 earnings with Bloomberg-estimated $65.91B revenue, building on its support for Wednesday's Nasdaq gains amid AI processor demand optimism.[1][2] AI fears persist but Nvidia's 'huge numbers' provide counterbalance per headlines.[1]

Dow futures decline amid tech digestion and US-Iran talks risks, following Wednesday's +0.63% gain; tariff refund chaos and broader market caution weigh in.[1][3] Less tech exposure offers no buffer from futures pointing lower.[1]
